title: Why JavaScript Still Dominates the Web
content: JavaScript continues to dominate web development due to its flexibility, huge ecosystem, and support across all major browsers. From front-end libraries like React to back-end platforms like Node.js, it's everywhere.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan

title: Understanding React Hooks in Depth
content: React Hooks let you use state and lifecycle methods in functional components. This post explains useState, useEffect, and custom hooks with real-world examples.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan

title: How to Build a REST API with Express.js
content: Express.js is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework. Learn how to create a CRUD API with Express and connect it to a MongoDB database.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan

title: CSS Grid vs Flexbox: When to Use Which
content: Both CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful layout tools. This guide compares them and explains which to use depending on your layout goals.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan

title: 10 Tips for Writing Clean Code
content: Clean code is easier to read, maintain, and scale. Here are 10 tips every developer should follow to keep their codebase tidy and efficient.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan

title: Getting Started with Next.js 14
content: Next.js 14 introduces new features like partial prerendering, enhanced routing, and faster builds. This guide walks you through creating your first app.
author: Abu Hurayra Khan
